Summary: President of Sri Lanka, H.E. Ranil Wickremesinghe, delivered a message on the occasion of the 75th Independence Day, addressing both Sinhala and Tamil communities. The message highlighted the significance of independence and unity for the nation's progress and development.

Title: 75th National Day Message – Hon. Prime Minister – 2023
Summary: In his 2023 National Day message, the Honorable Prime Minister addressed the nation on the occasion of the 75th National Day. The message highlighted the country's achievements and called for unity and progress moving forward.

Title: Independence Day Message of the Hon. Foreign Minister of Foreign Affairs– 2023
Summary: The Honorable Foreign Minister of Foreign Affairs delivered the Independence Day message for 2023 in English, Sinhala, and Tamil languages. The messages were shared to mark the National Day.

Title: President of Sri Lanka meets Envoys from the African Region
Summary: President Ranil Wickremesinghe of Sri Lanka met with envoys from the African region as part of the government's policy to strengthen ties with African countries. The meeting, organized by the Ministry, aimed to focus on reconnection and collaboration between Sri Lanka and the African continent.

Title: Appointment of High Commissioner of the Republic of Maldives to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of Maldives, with the concurrence of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Ali Faiz as the High Commissioner of the Republic of Maldives to Sri Lanka. He will be based in Colombo.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Republic of Ecuador to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of Ecuador, with the agreement of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Francisco Teodoro Guevara as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Ecuador to Sri Lanka.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Kingdom of Sweden to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Kingdom of Sweden, with the agreement of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Jan Thesleff as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Sweden to Sri Lanka. Mr. Thesleff will represent Sweden in Sri Lanka in his new role.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Czech Republic to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Czech Republic, in agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Dr. Ms. Eliška Žigová as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Czech Republic to Sri Lanka. She will be based in Sri Lanka to represent her country in diplomatic matters.

Title: Appointment of High Commissioner of the Malaysia to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of Malaysia, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Badli Hisham bin Adam as the new High Commissioner of Malaysia to Sri Lanka, stationed in Colombo. He has already presented his credentials to H.E. the President of Sri Lanka.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Slovak Republic to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Slovak Republic, in agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Róbert Maxián as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Slovak Republic to Sri Lanka. He will be based in Ne.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Republic of Armenia to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of Armenia, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Youri Babakhanian as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Armenia to Sri Lanka. Mr. Babakhanian will represent Armenia in Sri Lanka in his diplomatic capacity.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Republic of North Macedonia to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of North Macedonia, in agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Slobodan Uzunov as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of North Macedonia to Sri Lanka.

Title: Appointment of High Commissioner of Canada to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of Canada, with the approval of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Eric Walsh as the new High Commissioner of Canada to Sri Lanka. He is based in Colombo and has already presented his credentials to H.E. Ranil Wickremesinghe.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Republic of the Sudan to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of the Sudan, with the agreement of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Abdalla Omer Elhusain as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of the Sudan to Sri Lanka. This appointment strengthens diplomatic ties between the two nations.

Title: Appointment of High Commissioner of the Republic of Malawi to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of Malawi, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Leonard Mengezi as the High Commissioner of Malawi to Sri Lanka. He will be stationed in New Delhi.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Republic of Serbia to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of Serbia, in agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Sinisa Pavic as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Serbia to Sri Lanka. Mr. Pavic will represent Serbia in Sri Lanka in his diplomatic capacity.

Title: Appointment of High Commissioner of the United Republic of Tanzania to Sri Lanka
Summary: Ms. Anisa Kapufi Mbega has been appointed as the High Commissioner of the United Republic of Tanzania to Sri Lanka with the concurrence of the Government of Sri Lanka.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of Mongolia to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of Mongolia, in agreement with Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Ganbold Dambajav as Mongolia's Ambassador to Sri Lanka. He will be based in New Delhi.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of the Oriental Republic Uruguay to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Oriental Republic of Uruguay, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Alberto Guania Amarilla as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Sri Lanka.

Title: Appointment of High Commissioner of Jamaica to Sri Lanka
Summary: Mr. Jason K. Hall has been appointed as the High Commissioner of Jamaica to Sri Lanka, based in New Delhi, with the approval of both governments. He recently presented his credentials to H.E. Ranil Wi.

Title: Appointment of Ambassador of Republic of Côte d’Ivoire to Sri Lanka
Summary: The Government of the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. N’dry Eric Camille as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire to Sri Lanka.

Title: Sri Lanka concludes its Review under the 4th Cycle of the Universal (UPR)
Summary: Sri Lanka completed its review under the 4th Cycle of the Universal Periodic Review (UPR) in Geneva. Foreign Minister Ali Sabry led the Sri Lanka delegation and delivered remarks during the session. The review marks an important step in assessing Sri Lanka's human rights record.

Title: Sri Lanka to be reviewed under the 4th Cycle of the UPR
Summary: Sri Lanka's National Report will undergo review in the 4th Cycle of the Universal Periodic Review (UPR) by the UN Working Group on UPR on Wednesday, February 1, 2023, during its 42nd Session in Geneva. This evaluation aims to assess Sri Lanka's human rights situation and compliance with international standards.

Title: Foreign Minister Ali Sabry concludes official visit to Kingdom of Saudi Arabia
Summary: Foreign Minister Ali Sabry has concluded his official visit to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, following an invitation from His Highness Prince Faisal bin Farhan Al Saud, the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Saudi Arabia.

Title: Foreign Minister Ali Sabry to visit Saudi Arabia
Summary: Foreign Minister Ali Sabry is set to visit Saudi Arabia from January 23 to January 27, 2023, following an invitation from Saudi Arabia's Minister of Foreign Affairs, Prince Fais.

Title: Minister of External Affairs of India Dr. S. Jaishankar concludes visit to Sri Lanka
Summary: Indian External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar completed his official visit to Sri Lanka on January 20, 2023. He engaged in bilateral discussions with Sri Lankan Foreign Affairs Minister Ali S. during his visit.

Title: Indian External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar to visit Sri Lanka
Summary: Indian External Affairs Minister Dr. S. Jaishankar is set to visit Sri Lanka on January 19-20, 2023, for official discussions. The visit aims to strengthen bilateral relations between the two countries.

Title: Foreign Secretary Wijewardane and UK FCDO Permanent Under Secretary Sir Philip Barton hold discussions at Foreign Ministry Colombo
Summary: Foreign Secretary Aruni Wijewardane and UK FCDO Permanent Under Secretary Sir Philip Barton recently held discussions at the Foreign Ministry in Colombo. The meeting aimed to strengthen diplomatic ties between Sri Lanka and the United Kingdom.

Title: The message of H.E Ranil Wickremesinghe, President of Sri Lanka on the occasion of Thai Pongal
Summary: President of Sri Lanka, H.E. Ranil Wickremesinghe, delivered a message on the occasion of Thai Pongal, extending his warm wishes to all celebrating. The message highlighted the significance of Thai Pongal in Sri Lankan culture and traditions.

Title: The CEO of Qatar Charity calls on Foreign Minister
Summary: The CEO of Qatar Charity, Yousef Al-Kuwari, met with Foreign Minister Ali Sabry at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs on January 11, 2023. During the meeting, Foreign Minister Ali Sabry warmly welcomed the delegation from Qatar Charity.

Title: Foreign Minister summons the Acting High Commissioner of Canada to raise concerns
Summary: Foreign Minister Ali Sabry summoned Canadian Acting High Commissioner Daniel Bood to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs on January 11. He expressed the government's deep regret over Canada's unilateral announcement.

Title: Sri Lanka regrets decision by Canada to impose sanctions on two former Presidents of Sri Lanka
Summary: Sri Lanka expresses deep regret over Canada's politically motivated decision to impose sanctions on four individuals, including two former Presidents of Sri Lanka on January 10, 2023. This unilateral action by the Canadian Government has been met with disappointment by Sri Lanka.

Title: Foreign Minister Ali Sabry briefs the Colombo-based Diplomatic Corps on current developments
Summary: Foreign Minister Ali Sabry chaired the first diplomatic briefing for the Colombo-based Diplomatic Corps at the Ministry on January 10, 2023. During the briefing, Minister Sabry highlighted current developments in Sri Lanka and engaged with the diplomats to provide updates and foster diplomatic relations.

Title: President’s New Year Message
Summary: In his New Year message, the Honorable President addressed the nation with hopes for a prosperous year ahead. The President's message emphasized unity and progress for the country in the coming year.
